meanings.definition: A point of intersection of the vertical line through the center of buoyancy of a floating body when the body is tilted.
meanings.sent1: The metacenters help determine the stability of a ship when it tilts.
meanings.sent2: Engineers study the metacenters to ensure the ship stays balanced in water.
meanings.sent3: The metacenters of the boat had a little party when the waves rocked it gently.
meanings.sent4: The metacenters acted like anchors, keeping the ship steady in rough seas.
meanings.sent5: Remember, the metacenters are like the ship's balancing point in the water.

meanings.definition: The point at which the line of action of the buoyant force intersects the centerline of a floating body.
meanings.sent1: The metacenters play a crucial role in determining the stability of a floating object.
meanings.sent2: The engineers calculated the metacenters to ensure the boat's safety in the water.
meanings.sent3: The metacenters of the raft had a race to see who could stay in the middle the longest.
meanings.sent4: In a storm, the metacenters held the key to keeping the ship afloat.
meanings.sent5: Visualize the metacenters as the balancing act of a floating body in the ocean.
